<rule id="3rd-party-20000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <or>
                    <file filename="{*}splunk{*}.jar"/>
                    <project>
                        <artifact artifactId="{*}splunk{*}" groupId="{*}"/>
                    </project>
                </or>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint category-id="potential" effort="3" title="Embedded library - Splunk">
                    <message>
                        The application embeds the Splunk framework. To migrate a Java application that uses Splunk for log aggregation to Azure, you can follow this recommendation:

                        * Ensure your logging output is routed to the console and not to files.

                        * Configure the diagnostic setting to stream the console output to Azure Blob Storage.

                        * Use the Splunk Add-on for Microsoft Cloud Services to ingest logged events into Splunk.
                    </message>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/developer/java/migration/migrate-spring-cloud-to-azure-spring-apps?pivots=sc-standard-tier#ensure-console-logging-and-configure-diagnostic-settings" title="Ensure console logging and configure diagnostic settings"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/storage/blobs/" title="Azure Blob Storage"/>
                    <link href="https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/3757" title="Splunk Add-on for Microsoft Cloud Services"/>
                </hint>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Splunk</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>
